sen.j: 治承の大火（じしょうのたいか）は、治承3年3月24日 (旧暦)（1179年5月2日）に平安京内で起こった大火災。
sen.e: The Great Fire of Jisho happened within the Heian-kyo on May 2, 1179.
The Great Fire of Jisho happened within the Heian-kyo on May 2, 1179.
The Great Fire of Jisho happened within the Heian-kyo on May 9, 1179.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 「次郎焼亡」（じろうしょうぼう）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called the "Jiro shobo".
It is also called the "Jiro shobo".

sen.j: この日の夜半に七条東洞院から出火、折からの東風に煽られて朱雀大路に至るまでの三十数町が全焼した。
sen.e: The fire started during the night from Shichijo Higashinotoin and was spread by the west wind that was blowing at that time and reached the Suzaku-oji Street, buring about 35 cho of area.
The fire started during the night from Shichijo Higashinotoin and spread by the west wind that was blowing at that time and reached Suzaku-oji Street, burning and area of about thirty-five cho.
The fire started during the night from Shichijo Higashinotoin and spread by the east wind that was blowing at that time and reached Suzaku-oji Street, burning about thirty something cho.
sen.cmt: westをeastに変更しました。一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: この地域は当時の人口密集地であり、そこを直撃したことになる。
sen.e: The fire directly hit this area that was heavily populated at the time.

sen.j: そこは前年の太郎焼亡で焼け残った地域とも重なっており、人々に甚大な衝撃を与えた。
sen.e: It was the same area that was burned during the Taro shobo in the previous year and this shocked the people.

sen.j: なお、この火災の日付については、『玉葉』が3月24日、『後清録記』が4月24日のこととしており、『後清録記』の日付を採用する説もある。
sen.e: The date of this fire is mentioned as March 24 (lunar calendar) in the "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) and April 24 (lunar calendar) in "Goseirokuki" and there is a theory that proposes the date in "Goseirokuki" as correct.

The date of this fire is mentioned as May 9 (lunar calendar) in the "Gyokuyo" (Diary of FUJIWARA no Kanezane) and June 8 (lunar calendar) in "Goseirokuki" and there is a theory that proposes the date in "Goseirokuki" as correct.
sen.cmt: 上の日付に合わせて、グレゴリオ歴に日付に変更しました。
